skillTree.localised_description: By its very nature, being good at killing requires that you are equally adept at not dying.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: As it turns out, the more important the murder, the more likely they are to be carrying something worth 'appropriating'.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The cart into which Misericorde piles his ill-begotten Wyrdstone from his trips into Mordheim has gotten ever larger, and now resembles some swollen monstrosity, piled high with glowing green wares.
Misericorde might be in thrall to Clan Eshin, but he has few qualms about shipping some of the Wyrdstone from Mordheim to Clan Skryre for the last technologies.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +10% for Warplock Pistol units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for Warplock Pistol units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Warplock Pistol units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Warplock Pistol units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +30% for Warplock Pistol units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +15% for Warplock Pistol units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Misericorde carries great chunks of wyrdstone with him, feasting upon them whenever the need arises. The results are unpredictable, but almost always spectacular.
Casters who dare to call upon the winds of magic within the realm of Mordheim must be wary, or they shall be slapped by the curse of the Wyrdstone.
As Misericorde calls upon the magic inherent in Wyrdstone, a strange fog of repellant, oil, smoke builds up around him.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent casting spells.

skillTree.localised_description: Magic in the presence of so much wyrdstone simply does not function as one might expect, even for those used to the problems.
Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men

skillTree.localised_description: Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
Rats gnaw at the victim's defences, chewing them apart and rendering him open for attack.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for "Sorcerer's Curse Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Sorcerer's Curse"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Sorcerer's Curse Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The magic of Mordheim feasts upon itself, growing stronger the more magic is expelled into the atmosphere.
This creeping void of thickened air makes sight and shooting all but impossible. It is the perfect cover from which to stage an ambush.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Enshrouding Mist Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Intoxicating fumes flow forth from the caster, rendering himself and his allies immune to the effects of nearby enemies.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for "Musk of Courage Upgraded"

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Musk of Courage Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The withering eyes of the Horned Rat appear over the target, beams of wyrdstone glow spilling forth over the unfortunate victim.

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "Gaze of the Horned Rat"

skillTree.localised_description: Noxious clouds laced with magically-enhanced wyrdstone dust claw at the bodies and minds of all who step within them.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 120 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: With a flick of the paw, the spellcaster summons forth pure warpstone energy, sending it screaming forward.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread…

skillTree.localised_description: This one's intimate knowledge of the inner workings of Skaven machinery enables him to improve their efficiency on the battlefield.

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

Leadership: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% for Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

Leadership: +5 for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayers, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere – even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle – spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

factionEffects.localised_description: Sent to Mordheim by Clan Eshin, Misericorde of Clan Kreepus mines the valuable warpstone as he fends off the ever-encroaching advances of the Empire and others who would come to take his supplies.

effects.description: City of the Damned: The riches of Mordheim allow for Clan Kreepus to purchase many boons, whether that be allies in the Council of Thirteen, supplies to fight, or legendary characters to stand by their side.

Recruitment cost: +300% for all non-Eshin units
	(all armies)

Upkeep: +300% for all non-Eshin units
	(all armies)
Tradable resources produced and Income from trade tariffs: +5% for Clan Kreepus for each defensive or military Skaven ally

Enables poison attacks for all Verminkin and Skavenslave units
	(all armies)

Enables warpstone corruption attacks for all Warpguard, Night Runner, and Gutter Runner units
	(all armies)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: One of the most gifted Eshin Sorcerers of the current generic, Misericorde has been given control of Clan Kreepus by Nightlord Sneek, and sent to Mordheim to ensure a steady and continual flow of the precious wyrdstone to his superiors. Misericorde, of course, has plans of his own, and other sponsors to seek out.

effects.description:
Attribute: Devastating Flanker for Black Skaven, Death Runner, and Eshin Triad units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
